parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end.  This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking and reporting campaign spending, mandated for candidates and parties.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions USR (Uniunea Salvați România), a parliamentary candidate party.  It doesn't name specific candidates but clearly promotes the party. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>This is a paid Facebook post, inherently designed to reach a wide audience. The message is not a private communication; it's intended for public consumption. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's primary objective is to encourage voters to support USR in the parliamentary elections. Phrases like "Votați echipa USR" (Vote for the USR team) and the arguments presented ("garanții democrației și a luptei anti-corupție" - guarantees of democracy and the fight against corruption) directly aim to influence voting behavior. This clearly fulfills "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>While the post touches upon political issues, it lacks the objectivity and neutrality expected of journalistic reporting.  It's a clear advocacy piece promoting a specific party, not an unbiased analysis of political events.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a structured political message promoting a specific party's platform and urging voters to support them.  The language used is persuasive and promotional, not simply expressive of personal views.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1279326216711414</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific parliamentary candidate (USR), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, has a clear electoral objective (influencing votes for USR), and lacks the objectivity of journalistic reporting. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's arguments, while framed as factual claims, are presented in a persuasive manner designed to sway voters.  There are no counterarguments or alternative perspectives offered.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>USR</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
USR Maramureș, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări pe Facebook (ID 1279326216711414) cu conținut electoral, care promovează USR și îndeamnă la vot pentru acest partid, folosind argumente persuasive și un limbaj promoțional, fără obiectivitate jurnalistică.  Prezența numărului CMF 11240015 confirmă natura electorală a postării. Fraze precum „Votați echipa USR” și afirmațiile despre „garanții democrației și a luptei anti-corupție” au un efect electoral clar, vizând influențarea votului în favoarea USR.  Această postare, fiind plătită și având o vizibilitate publică pe Facebook, constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea perioadei legale de campanie.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
